name: Typo
body:
### Introduction

Initialize Typo with an Android context and provide a FontMapper

`Typo.init(context).withFontMapper(new MyFontMapper())`

and use it in a layout file

`<com.leondroid.typo.views.TypoTextView
            xmlns:custom="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto" 
            android:layout_width="wrap_content"
            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
            android:text="Extra Light Italic"
            custom:typoName="@string/my_font_name"
            custom:typoStyle="@integer/extra_light_italic" />`

MyFontMapper has to implement FontMapper and will force you to provide my_font_name
and for each style a path to a typeface in assets. You can derive from DefaultFontMapper
that will ease the process a little bit.
